step1.sentence: She set daily reminders to help her stay on track with her fitness goals.

step2.story: James had a big product launch coming up and knew he had to stay on track. He blocked off two hours each morning for focused work, ignoring messages until noon. By the end of the week, every milestone was checked off.

step3.story: When Maya started her master's thesis, she felt overwhelmed by the sheer amount of research ahead of her. Her advisor told her to break the project into weekly targets so she could stay on track without burning out. Some weeks were harder than others — unexpected lab results sent her scrambling to revise whole chapters. Still, she kept her weekly check-ins, adjusting the plan rather than abandoning it. Slowly, the pile of half-written sections transformed into a coherent argument. On the day she submitted, she realized that staying on track had never been about perfection; it was about consistent, patient progress.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 궤도 위에 머물다, 즉 정해진 경로나 계획에서 벗어나지 않는다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 목표·일정·계획을 예정대로 유지하거나 진행 중인 일을 흐트러짐 없이 계속할 때 사용한다. '계획대로 가다', '진도를 유지하다'의 의미로 일상·업무·학업 등 다양한 상황에 폭넓게 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'track'은 원래 기차나 수레가 지나가는 레일·경로를 뜻하며, 여기서 '정해진 방향'이라는 추상적 의미로 확장되었다. 'stay on track'은 기차가 선로를 벗어나지 않고 달리는 이미지에서 비롯된 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 외부 방해나 유혹이 있는 상황에서도 집중력과 규율을 유지한다는 뉘앙스가 강하다. 코치·상사·선생님이 격려나 조언을 줄 때 자주 사용하며, 긍정적이고 실용적인 어조를 띤다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Let's have a quick check-in every Monday to make sure we stay on track.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 매주 월요일 짧게 현황을 점검해서 계획대로 진행되는지 확인합시다.
